name: SupportCormagAndDuessel
_source: speak;Cormag;I am as you see me.|Fine in every respect.
speak;Duessel;I'm not talking about your flesh.|It's your heart I'm worried for.

speak;Duessel;I'm here because I made the decision for myself to leave Grado.|Luckily for me, one of the leaders here is an old acquaintance of mine.|I'm not saying my heart is at ease, but I have found something to believe in.|Something to fight for.|And yet, you...
speak;Cormag;I, too, made a choice to be here.|There's no need for your concern.
speak;Cormag;I believe in myself.|Therefore it matters not where I am.|So no matter where I go or what I do, I'm sure my brother would understand.
speak;Cormag;And besides, General Duessel, you're here in this army with me.|There's no shame in fighting alongside the man once known as Obsidian.
speak;Duessel;Mm.|Cormag, let us emerge victorious from this war, for the things we both believe in.
speak;Duessel;Well met, Cormag.|I'm impressed by your skills.
speak;Cormag;They're still far below yours, General Duessel.|By the way, I have a favor I've been meaning to ask of you.
speak;Cormag;Your stories tell of a small lance you carry like a treasure.|May I see it?
speak;Duessel;Stories, you say?|Am I the subject of stories now?|Interesting.|Here is the lance you're talking about.|Examine it at your leisure.

speak;Duessel;Oh!|You've heard of Gavaleus, have you?|You must know quite a bit about the crafting of weapons.|This is one of Gavaleus's final works.|I have quite a collection of weapons, but this is among the most beautiful of them.|While it can be used in battle, I would never dull its shine with blood or dirt.|If I ever use this lance, I vow that it will be only in my own final hour.
speak;Cormag;It shines as though it could light up the soul of its wielder.|You're right.|I would hesitate to stain its beauty with blood, too.
speak;Duessel;Ah, so you grasp what I mean?|Cormag, you have a discerning eye.
speak;Cormag;Thank you.|And yet, I know that I will never be your equal, General Duessel.
speak;Duessel;Come, now.|You know, your brother asked to see this lance once as well.
speak;Duessel;Yes.|You two are so alike.|His comments mirror your own almost exactly.
speak;Duessel;For warriors, our weapons are our lives.|I'm glad to know you understand that.|Someday, you'll be a splendid wyvern knight to equal your brother.
speak;Duessel;Cormag...|I've something I want to show you.|Here it is.|This lance.|What do you think of it?
speak;Cormag;My!|It has such power!|It sends chills down my spine...|I am not nearly strong enough to wield a weapon such as this.

speak;Duessel;Hm, you think so?|Merely holding this lance makes me tremble with dread.|Not overly so, but enough to stop me from wielding it in combat.|This lance...|It can drive its wielder to madness.

speak;Duessel;Yes, Cormag.|It's a magic weapon of dark design that's been in my family for ages.|Legend states that the leader of our house must always carry it, but never use it.|We are prohibited from wielding it until such a time as madness itself rules the day.|It's part of my legacy, and yet...I...|I made a grave error...|I allowed Valter to use this lance.

speak;Duessel;Yes...|...We were in the middle of a battle.|Valter had broken his lance, and when I wasn't looking he somehow took this one.|From that moment, he was changed...|He killed everyone–even retreating men.|I took the lance from him when I realized what had happened, but it was too late.|Madness had awakened within Valter and was coursing through his body.|From then on, he hungered only for battle and for blood...|It's not as though Valter was a gentle lamb before, but now his appetite for violence increased many times over.|It's all because of this cursed lance.

speak;Cormag;That odd light playing around the point...|I thought it looked familiar.|It was Valter...|It's the same light Valter had in his eyes on the battlefield.|Valter's insane because of this lance.
speak;Cormag;Sir Duessel, if it please you, would you let me have this lance?
speak;Cormag;Are you worried that I will end up like Valter?

speak;Cormag;This lance–someone needs to master it.|It's just a feeling I have.|A weapon is only as good or evil as the man who wields it.|In the hands of someone just, it can be a righteous weapon.|In the hands of the wicked, it's a danger to all.|Believe me, I have not been seduced by this lance.|I merely want to see it used for the purpose for which it was forged.

speak;Duessel;I understand you, Cormag.|I'm going to let you have it.|I have no son.|I had not yet decided to whom I should pass on this legacy.|Now I see that leaving it to someone whom I trust and believe in is best.|As with me, your admiration of weapons is balanced by a healthy respect.|You also have a good eye, and you possess tremendous strength.|The day you are able to wield this lance may not be far off at all.|If the madness in this lance can be tamed, it may very well be a weapon without equal.|...I never had the courage to wield it, but I would love to see it used righteously.|...I am entrusting it to you.|I hope you will use it one day.

speak;Cormag;I accept your gift, Sir Duessel.|I would receive it once this battle is finished and our hearts are calmer.|If I were to take it in the heat of battle, I might become Valter the second.|It is a possibility that I cannot dismiss.
speak;Duessel;Yes, I see.|Cormag...|I'm counting on you.|I look forward to the day I can see this lance wielded correctly.
speak;Cormag;Understood.|Until that time comes, please try not to get yourself killed, General Duessel!
